features: All-purpose emergency salve for all your skin needs
This power-packed, portable, plant-based First Aid salve is essential for every adventure, backpack, first aid kit, diaper bag, glove box, and bug out kit
Great for cuts, scrapes, insect bites, chapping, chafing, sunburns, blisters, rashes, abrasions, itching, cracked skin, and more
Power packed with calendula, comfrey, and yarrow
Our products are all-natural, plant-based, organic, cruelty free, and made in the USA
Does not contain parabens, phthalates, petrochemicals, or artificial ingredients
We are women owned, family run, and B-Corp certified

productInformation.name: Product Benefits
productInformation.value: It’s your first defense for cuts, scrapes, blisters, sunburns, chafing, poison ivy, and cracked hands & feet. It also helps to relieve the itch and sting of insect bites and can be used as a wound dressing. See more

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: CALENDULA Prevents dryness + Moisturizes skin Calendula is one of the easiest herbs to grow in your garden. It is a forever-giving plant in that it self-seeds, wards off pests, and has a variety of uses. It is rich in antioxidants, helps keep skin hydrated, and is a great skin protector. COMFREY Protects + Coats skin from irritants Comfrey is a flowering plant that has been used for centuries. Because of the presence of some phytochemicals, it is typically used topically and not recommended for deep wounds. It is soothing and regenerative for the skin. YARROW Astringent + Cleansing Yarrow is in the daisy family and was famously used in the Trojan War. The yarrow plant has beneficial flavonoids and salicylic acid. It is gentle, tightens the skin, and is great for wound care. ST. JOHN'S WORT Moisturizing + Soothing St. John’s Wort is a flowering plant that has been in regular use since classical antiquity. It has a rich composition including, antioxidants, vitamins, flavonoids, tannins, fatty acids, and essential oils. It is moisturizing, soothing, nourishing, cleansing, and pain relieving.

First Aid Skin Repair Pain Relief Dry Skin Hand Goo Benefits All-Purpose Topical First Aid Multi-purpose, skin-rejuvenating salve and daily moisturizer Temporarily helps ease the aching of arthritis, sore muscles, and bruises Helps temporarily relieve symptoms associated with chronic skin conditions Soothes, protects, moisturizes, and relieves pain Key Ingredients Calendula, Comfrey, Yarrow, St. John's Wort Blue Yarrow, Blue Chamomile, Rosehip Seed Oil, Aloe Vera, Vitamin E Arnica, Ginger, Peppermint, Cinnamon Calendula, Elder, Yarrow, Jojoba Seed Oil Calendula, Comfrey, Yarrow, St. John's Wort Plant-Based ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Use for just about everything!
reviews.reviewText: I always like to have this on hand! My senior rescue likes to chew on her paws and really chews and licks the inside of her back legs and that area and sometimes her tail, until it gets really red and almost bleeding. I put this on her (a little goes a long way), and by the next day, if not sooner, it's almost gone! Also works great on the pesky, itchy insect bites. One problem is she seems to love the taste, so I have to keep her from licking it off and doing it's thing. Definitely recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works really well
reviews.reviewText: I have this in both the stick and the tin and I like both. I'm not sure that there is no possibility of cross contamination so that may be a negative, but that is the only thing I'm not crazy about. If you use q-tips or some other applicator to scoop out an amount rather than using a finger on it, it would probably be a best practice. I used this on several different little cuts I've had over the past few months and it keeps the skin moisturized without being sticky or attracting dirt. None of the places I've used it on became infected and they have all healed well, so I guess it works! It also smells good, which is nice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Used this in a wasp sting, great results!
reviews.reviewText: This worked great on my kiddo who just got a sting this week. The reaction was small and didn't bother him much after initial irritation went away

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product for mosquito bites
reviews.reviewText: Where I live , we have been getting really bad mosquito bites all over our legs. They itch so much. Since I dis this brand, I really like it. It does help with first aid but work wonders on those bites. Soon as you put just a little salve on the bite. It instantly stops itching and begins the healing process.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’ve been using this for everything for 5 years. I have 3 at all times. Kitchen bathroom & in my bag. And I’ve used it for myself my kids my dogs and random strangers at parks! It’s a hit. And also learned on 3 occasions how helpful it can be for immediate bee stings when I have nothing to make a paste. I’ve recommended to many people. And all my herbal friends give it a thumbs up!
